key_title: Key to the subspecies of Austrostipa rudis

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Stipa
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria Volume 2 Ferns and Akllied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Stipa. In: Walsh, N.G., Entwisle, T.J., Flora of Victoria Volume 2 Ferns and Akllied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons, pp. 373-397. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Awn 60–90 mm long, column 32–45 mm long; lemma 8.6–11.5 mm long; glumes broadly obtuse with 1–2 mm of delicately membranous, often erose tip, upper glume 11–14.5 mm long
Awn less than 65 mm long, column less than 30 mm long, lemma 5–10 mm long; lower glume usually narrowly truncate
Callus 1.5–2.5 mm long, usually more than 20% the length of lemma; column 20–25 mm long; upper glume membranous at tip, 9–12.5 mm long; hairs of lemma not extending to apex of lemma

Callus 0.8–1.7 mm long, usually less than 20% the length of lemma; column less than 20 mm long; upper glume firm at tip, 7–10 mm long; hairs of lemma often extending to apex and exserted as a sparse coma to 1 mm long
